text: Ernest Mason Satow GCMG PCErnest Mason Satow was known in Japan as "" (Ānesuto Satō), known in China as (traditional Chinese) "薩道義" or (simplified Chinese) "萨道义" (30 June 1843 - 26 August 1929), was a British scholar, diplomat and Japanologist.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Satow, Ernest Mason," Japan Encyclopedia, p. 829; Nish, Ian. (2004). British Envoys in Japan 1859–1972, pp. 78–88. ==Career== Along with William George Aston and Basil Hall Chamberlain, Satow was one of three major British Japanologists during the 19th century. ==Selected works== In an overview of writings by and about Ernest Mason Satow, OCLC/WorldCat lists roughly 200+ works in 300+ publications in 9 languages and 4,000+library holdings.
